Bookends a series of one-shot revivals of seven golden age comic titles, focusing on the return of individual members of the Justice Society of America: Adventure comics (Starman, the Atom); All-American comics (Green Lantern, Johnny Thunder); National comics (Flash, Mr. Terrific); Sensation comics (Wonder Woman, Hawkgirl); Star spangled comics (Sandman, Star Spangled Kid); and, Thrilling comics (Hawkman, Wildcat).
Stories of the Justice Society of America are continued in the ongoing title: JSA.

Astro Boy is an indestructible, super-powered robot saved from a circus sideshow by Dr. Elefun, who instills him with human qualities and creates a robot sister, Astro Girl. Together, they battle against evil, Astro Boy using his remarkable powers to defend justice and fight the galaxy's villains.
Originally produced in Japan by Osamu Tezuka for Mushi Productions and syndicated by NBC Films in an English-dubbed version in the United States.

Sources used: copyright data sheet; copyright data base; McNeil, A. Total television, 3rd. ed., p. 62; Terrace, V. Encyclopedia of television--series, pilots and specials, 1937-1973, p. 34; Lenburg, J. The encyclopedia of animated cartoons, p. 278-279.

Astro Boy is an indestructible, super-powered robot saved from a circus sideshow by Dr. Elefun, who instills him with human qualities and creates a robot sister, Astro Girl. Together, they battle against evil, Astro Boy using his remarkable powers to defend justice and fight the galaxy's villains.
Originally produced in Japan by Osamu Tezuka for Mushi Productions and syndicated by NBC Films in an English-dubbed version in the United States.

Sources used: copyright data sheet; copyright data base; McNeil, A. Total television, 3rd. ed., p. 62; Terrace, V. Encyclopedia of television--series, pilots and specials, 1937-1973, p. 34; Lenburg, J. The encyclopedia of animated cartoons, p. 278-279.
